messages.title: A future fair for families
messages.content: Six pledges to do right by you and your family including securing the recovery. Supporting 'ordinary families' over 'bankers' bonuses'. Also talks about halving the deficit through economic growth, fair taxes, and cuts to lower priority budgets.

messages.title: Why we're voting Labour
messages.content: Different individuals explaining their reasons to support Labour. Topics include building a Britain for all, support for young families, and various social benefits.

messages.title: The General election is a two horse race
messages.content: Emphasizing that the election in the area is mainly between Labour and the Conservatives.

messages.title: Job guarantees for 18 to 24 year-olds
messages.content: Promise of a job for those out of work for six months, saying no one should be left on the dole.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Halving the deficit through economic growth, fair taxes, and cuts to lower priority budgets.
Supporting young families, the introduction of family friendly working hours and making the NHS more accessible to working people.
A pledge to help young people into work, offering job guarantees for 18 to 24-year-olds out of work for more than six months.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The election in the area is predominantly between Labour and the Conservatives

issues.economy: Pledges to support the economy by securing the recovery and halving the deficit
issues.health: Making NHS more accessible to working people
issues.socialWelfare: Support for young and working families

endorsements.endorsement: Actor David Tennant backs Gordon Brown as Prime Minister

quotes.text: It's neck and neck - only Labour can beat the Tories

images.caption: Photos of Glenda Jackson with supporters and constituents
